After living together for 15 years, CLAIRE BLOOM and PHILIP ROTH were married on Sunday at the Manhattan home of BARBARA EPSTEIN, a co-editor of The New York Review of Books. ''We just thought it was about time,'' Miss Bloom said.

The 59-year old actress and the writer, who is 57, will continue to divide their time among Manhattan, London and an 18th-century house in Connecticut, Miss Bloom said, and they will continue their busy and separate careers.
Miss Bloom has been married twice before, and Mr. Roth once. Judge SHIRLEY FINGERHOOD of New York City Civil Court in Manhattan, an old friend of Miss Bloom, officiated.

Last night, Miss Bloom appeared at the Metropolitan Museum of Art to read from, and participate in a discussion of, two Virginia Woolf novels as part of a series, ''The Feminist and the Novelist.'' Mr. Roth did not attend, Miss Bloom said, adding, ''He's heard me read before.''
